column5: Yes..... the May long weekend is a ways away, but I'm eager to start planning a small fishing trip fro my buddies.  The past 5 years we have fished either the French River or Lake Nip., and this year we want to try a new location  closer to Toronto.  Typically we rent a cottage and boat for the weekend and fish all day and all night.  Can someone please suggest a new location.  We enjoy fishing for perch, pickerel and pike. Thanks for you help.
forget the may 24 take a couple of days off in june and go to Lakaire .........................YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Try the Moon River basin on Georgian Bay. It is only a 2 hour drive from Toronto
i second the moon river.  good fishing and great scenery.  not sure but i think some parts of the moon are open may 1st.  closer to gbay opening.  check the regs it could be tricky  Cheers!
You'll enjoy the moon and Bill at Moon River Cottages is a great guy! Careful though - it has taken a prop or two.  :-)
You just might run into a few OFC members if you give the Bay of Quinte area a try...

Yup Bay of Quinte is not far from Toronto the Walleye usually bite very well with the odd pike in the 3 to 12 pound range.Nice size perch too.  Lots of places to stay.Navigation is a breeze and many very friendly people.  I will be staying at Mohawk Bay Campround May 24 weekend.you can rent trailers and boats there.  Bayside Cottages is another great location.I stay there during the Quinte tournament.
Thanks for the replies. I'm thinking of trying the Moon!! I love going north.   Any suggestions on were to stay, just in case Bill at Moon River Cottages is booked.  Thanks again!
